thread.title: Male fertility in a wheelchair: Pregnancy announcement photo goes viral
thread.title_full: Male fertility in a wheelchair: Pregnancy announcement photo goes viral

author: news.com.au
title: Male fertility in a wheelchair: Pregnancy announcement photo goes viral
text:
AMANDA Diesen and Todd Krieg didn’t think their pregnancy announcement photo would go viral but the story behind it shows you why it did. 
The couple met when Amanda was working as a therapist at a paralysis centre in California when Todd, who had been a paraplegic since 2014, had come in looking to receive therapy at the centre in 2015.
Todd has become paralysed from the chest down after a dirt bike accident. He developed a crush on Amanda and drunkenly confessing his crush to her.
“I dropped my job working with paralysed clients in a gym setting and now work as a social worker for persons with developmental disabilities,” Amanda said. 
“I admire Todd for the struggles he’s been through and hardship he now faces with being in a wheelchair and unable to walk. He is in constant pain from his injury, yet finds a way to put on a happy face in order to love me and others well.”
Todd set up a pregnancy announcement shoot after they discovered she was pregnant even after doctors had told them it would be near impossible. He also surprised her with a proposal during the shoot.
Amanda Diesen and Todd Krieg in the pregnancy photo that went viral. Picture: Karen Duffy Photography Source: Supplied
